Article Title: How Google DeepMind‚Äôs new AI models can improve vision and reasoning in robots
Article Text:
How these two new AI models will work for robots

Google DeepMind has recently introduced two new artificial intelligence (AI) models, Gemini Robotics-ER 1.5 and Gemini Robotics 1.5. These new models are designed to enhance the capabilities of general-purpose robots significantly. The models are designed to operate in tandem, improving a robot's reasoning, vision, and ability to execute actions in real-world settings.According to a blog shared by the company, this new two-model system will split the planning and execution tasks. Gemini Robotics-ER 1.5 will serve as the planner or orchestrator, determining the steps needed, while Gemini Robotics 1.5 is responsible for executing the physical functions based on natural language instructions.This separation is intended to overcome the limitations of earlier single-model systems, which often led to errors and delays when attempting to plan and perform actions simultaneously.The ER 1.5 model serves as a vision-language model (VLM) capable of advanced reasoning and integrating external tools. It can generate multi-step plans for tasks and shows strong performance on spatial understanding benchmarks. The model can also access resources, such as Google Search, to gather information and inform decision-making in physical environments.After a plan is created, Gemini Robotics 1.5, a vision-language-action (VLA) model, comes in. This model converts instructions and visual data into motor commands, allowing the robot to execute tasks. It determines the most efficient way to complete actions and can provide natural language explanations of its decisions.The system enables robots to handle complex, multi-step commands smoothly. For instance, a robot could sort items into compost, recycling, and trash bins by checking local recycling guidelines online, analysing objects, planning the sorting, and then executing the process.DeepMind notes that the AI models are adaptable to robots of various shapes and sizes due to their spatial awareness and flexible design. Currently, the ER 1.5 planner is available to developers via the Gemini API in Google AI Studio, while the VLA model is limited to select partners.This represents a step toward integrating generative AI into robotics, using natural language for control and separating planning from execution to reduce errors.
Article Summary: Gemini Robotics-ER 1.5 will serve as the planner or orchestrator, while Gemini Robotics 1. 5 is responsible for executing the physical functions based on natural language instructions. This separation is intended to overcome the limitations of earlier single-model systems, which often led to errors.

Article Title: Optus outage in Australia: What we know about the fatal triple-0 emergency call failures
Article Text:
Company knew of problems hours before resolution

Optus‚Äô previous failures raise accountability questions





Australia's second-largest telecommunications provider Optus is facing mounting pressure after a 13-hour emergency services outage led to four deaths and caused 600 triple-zero calls to fail across multiple states. The September 19 network failure has prompted government investigations and renewed calls for accountability from the embattled telco.The outage primarily affected South Australia, Western Australia, and the Northern Territory, with some impact also recorded in far western New South Wales near the SA border, according to Reuters reporting. CEO Stephen Rue confirmed that established processes were not followed during a network firewall upgrade that began at 12:30 AM Thursday and lasted until approximately 1:30 PM (local time).Four deaths have been linked to the incident, though South Australian police later clarified that an eight-week-old boy's death in Gawler West was "unlikely" to have been caused by the outage delay. A 68-year-old Adelaide woman and two men aged 74 and 49 in Perth remain connected to the emergency services failure.The Australian Broadcasting Company (ABC) reported that Optus received multiple customer complaints about the triple-zero failure as early as 9 AM Thursday, with five customers contacting the call center about the outage.However, these concerns were not properly escalated, and government authorities weren't informed until after the issue was resolved.Communications Minister Anika Wells expressed "unbelievable disappointment" that Australia was "here again so quickly," referencing a similar 2023 incident. The Australian Media and Communications Authority (ACMA) chair Nerida O'Loughlin revealed her agency wasn't notified until more than 10 hours after the outage began, contrary to standard protocols.This marks the second major triple-zero outage for Optus in less than two years. The company was fined A$12 million in 2023 for failing to provide emergency call services to thousands during a nationwide outage and subsequently failing to conduct required welfare checks.The telecommunications giant, owned by Singapore Telecommunications, has faced a series of crises including a 2022 cyberattack affecting 9.5 million Australians and the 2023 outage that led to former CEO Kelly Bayer Rosmarin's resignation. Current CEO Stephen Rue took over in November 2024.Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, speaking from New York, declined to say whether Rue should resign but indicated the government has "action at its disposal" pending investigation results. ACMA has launched a formal investigation, with Optus potentially facing fines exceeding $10 million and additional penalties.The company has promised full cooperation with all investigations while conducting its own internal review, with results to be made public.
Article Summary: 13-hour emergency services outage led to four deaths and 600 triple-zero calls to fail. Optus received multiple customer complaints about the outage as early as 9 AM Thursday. Government authorities weren't informed until after the issue was resolved. This marks the second major triple- zero outage for Optus in less than two years.

Article Title: Jony Ive designed a lantern for his sailboat and now you can buy one for $4,800
Article Text: Sir Jony Ive couldn't find a decent lantern for his sailboat, so naturally, he designed one himself. The result is the Sailing Lantern‚Äîa 1.5kg chunk of machined stainless steel and precision-ground glass that costs $4,800 and looks like maritime jewelry.It's the first collaboration between Ive's LoveFrom collective and Tokyo-based Balmuda, limited to just 1,000 pieces. According to the Financial Times, Ive describes it as addressing extreme functional challenges: "Most stainless steels will corrode. Only a few are marine grade."The design draws from vintage ship lanterns, though Ive told Wallpaper* he avoided mere nostalgia. "The reason this feels familiar isn't because we took elements that previously existed. The reason it is familiar is humanity and ingenuity," he explained. He's been sailing since childhood, and when you're on the water, your connection to nature demands tools that can actually survive out there.Balmuda founder Gen Terao called the engineering process formidable‚Äîa couple of very hard years getting everything to Ive's exacting standards. The lantern uses LEDs that mimic natural light, starting with a reddish glow at low settings and shifting to white-blue at full brightness, like actual flames.When you turn it off, the light slowly extinguishes rather than clicking dead.The textured polyester strap resists salt and sun. The flower-shaped dial clicks satisfyingly. The whole thing weighs enough to feel substantial, and Ive casually tossed it around during interviews to prove it's genuinely rugged, not precious."As I've got older, who I work with has become far more important than what I work on," Ive told Wallpaper*. Most of these lanterns will probably never see a boat‚Äîlike diving watches that spend their lives at dinner parties‚Äîbut that's sort of the point.
Article Summary: Sir Jony Ive's LoveFrom collective and Tokyo-based Balmuda collaborated on the Sailing Lantern. The 1.5kg chunk of machined stainless steel and precision- ground glass costs $4,800. The design draws from vintage ship lanterns, but Ive avoided mere nostalgia.

Its AI-driven suggestions can be tailored to your current skill level, allowing learners to focus on areas they find most challenging, whether it‚Äôs vocabulary retention, grammar rules, or speaking fluency.By following a structured approach using well-crafted prompts, beginners can make consistent progress without feeling overwhelmed. For years, there‚Äôs been something about Zomato that made me uneasy.

We made eating out and ordering in easier than ever, but we never really helped people truly eat better. Yes, you could find a salad or a smoothie bowl, but the truth is, if you wanted to eat genuinely nourishing food, Zomato didn‚Äôt make it easy.

Today, we‚Äôve taken one of the biggest steps in fixing that blind spot. We‚Äôre launching Healthy Mode on Zomato.

Every dish in this mode now comes with a Healthy Score‚Äîfrom Low to Super‚Äîbased on what really counts for your health: protein, complex carbs, fibre, and micronutrients, and not just calories. Behind the scenes it‚Äôs AI and restaurant data doing the heavy lifting, but what you‚Äôll see is simple: a clear explanation of what makes a dish healthy, and why.

This is not your run of the mill ‚Äúhealthy mode‚Äù for beginners. We have kept the bar very high, that professional athletes can rely on healthy mode to find food that works for them.

Article Title: K-Visa: What is China's rival to America's H-1B visa
Article Text:
What is K visa



Who is eligible for K visa



Why K visa matters





Starting October 1, China will roll out a new visa category known as the K visa. The new visa is aimed at attracting foreign science and technology talent. The timing is notable as the K visa comes just weeks after the US announced a $100,000 annual fee for H-1B visas, which are widely used by tech companies to hire skilled workers from countries like India. With the higher cost raising concerns among both employers and applicants, Beijing‚Äôs new programme is being seen as an alternative pathway for professionals. For those unaware, the K visa was first announced in August this year. It is part of China‚Äôs wider effort to show that it is open to foreign talent and investment, even as trade and technology tensions with Washington continues. While China has traditionally relied on domestic engineers and repatriating Chinese-born scientists, this new initiative marks one of its rare attempts to directly target young, overseas STEM graduates for jobs and research opportunities.As mentioned above, China first announced the K visa in August, 2025. It is aimed at attracting young foreign graduates in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM). K visa allows entry, residence, and employment in China without requiring a job offer or employer sponsorship ‚Äî a key difference from the U.S. H-1B visa Official guidelines from Beijing mention requirements around age, education, and work experience, but so far the details remain vague.The programme is designed to appeal to recent STEM graduates from abroad, particularly those who may otherwise have looked to the U.S. for opportunities.Immigration experts say the biggest draw of the K visa is the absence of employer sponsorship. By comparison, the H-1B system in the U.S. requires sponsorship, is capped at 85,000 slots a year, and will now carry a steep $100,000 annual fee for companies.For many Indian professionals ‚Äî who accounted for 71% of approved H-1B visas last year ‚Äî the K visa could appear as an alternative pathway. However, hurdles remain. Language barriers, limited details on residency or family sponsorship, and political tensions between India and China could restrict uptake.Despite uncertainties, analysts say the timing of the K visa is significant. With Washington raising barriers, Beijing is positioning itself as open to foreign talent. Even if adoption is modest, China sees it as a step toward strengthening its position in the global competition for technology expertise.

How the campaign worked

Impact on travellers



White house clarification







US President Donald Trump recently announced a massive hike in the H-1B visa fee. After the revised regulation, the H-1B visa fee for fresh application stands at $1,00,000. The trolls started the checkout process for multiple tickers on busy routes such as Delhi to New York or Dallas without completing the payment process. This temporarily held the seats, making them unavailable to genuine travelers. Once the hold expired, the process was repeated, effectively clogging airline booking systems and driving up ticket prices.Some of the trollers also bagged about holding ‚Äú100 seats‚Äù at a time, with posts laced with racist slurs and calls to ‚Äúkeep Indians in India.‚ÄùThis Clog The Toilet campaign coincided with the widespread panic among the Indian tech workers. Article Summary: 4chan users launched ‚ÄúOperation Clog the Toilet,‚Äù deliberately blocking India-US flight bookings amid panic over a $100,000 H-1B visa fee. Article Title: Angry French government to Telegram founder Pavel Durov: You like making accusations while elections are ongoing
Article Text:
'French Spies...': Telegram CEO Drops BOMBSHELL Amid Russian 'Meddling' Claims I Moldova Election

Poll Should international tech platforms be involved in political matters in foreign countries? Yes, they can promote democracy No, they should remain neutral

Telegram founder's full Twitter post that has angered France

About a year ago, while I was stuck in Paris, the French intelligence services reached out to me through an intermediary, asking me to help the Moldovan government censor certain Telegram channels ahead of the presidential elections in Moldova.

After reviewing the channels flagged by French (and Moldovan) authorities, we identified a few that clearly violated our rules and removed them. The intermediary then informed me that, in exchange for this cooperation, French intelligence would ‚Äúsay good things‚Äù about me to the judge who had ordered my arrest in August last year.

This was unacceptable on several levels. If the agency did in fact approach the judge ‚Äî it constituted an attempt to interfere in the judicial process. If it did not, and merely claimed to have done so, then it was exploiting my legal situation in France to influence political developments in Eastern Europe ‚Äî a pattern we have also observed in Romania üá∑üá¥

Shortly thereafter, the Telegram team received a second list of so-called ‚Äúproblematic‚Äù Moldovan channels. Unlike the first, nearly all of these channels were legitimate and fully compliant with our rules. Their only commonality was that they voiced political positions disliked by the French and Moldovan governments.

We refused to act on this request. Telegram is committed to freedom of speech and will not remove content for political reasons. I will continue to expose every attempt to pressure Telegram into censoring our platform. Stay tuned.





French government has slammed Telegram founder Parel Durov after latter accused French intelligence services of having asked him through an intermediary to censor some Moldovan voices. In a long post on Twitter, Telegram founder claimed that the French agency made the request around one year ago asking him to help the Moldovan government censor certain Telegram channels ahead of the presidential elections in Moldova. In May 2025, Durov said that the head of France's foreign intelligence agency had asked him to ban Romanian conservative voices ahead of elections there. France's DGSE, the foreign intelligence service, denied that at the time.Durov was arrested in August 2024 at a French airport and is under judicial supervision in France while being investigated for suspected organised crime on the Telegram app.
Article Summary: Telegram founder Parel Durov accused French intelligence services of having asked him through an intermediary to censor some Moldovan voices. Article Title: Technology, multi-polarity, self-reliance part of one basket: EAM Jaishankar on global developments
